newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-SOUTH AFRICAN GETS TWO-YEAR BAN FOR DRUG ABUSE.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-SOUTH AFRICAN GETS TWO-YEAR BAN FOR DRUG ABUSE.

text.p: A South African player has been suspended for the maximum period of two years after failing a drugs test, the South African Rugby Football Union (SARFU) said on Tuesday.
Western Transvaal prop Rocco Pedder was banned from playing rugby at all levels until September 3 1998.
SARFU declined to name the banned substance involved but said Pedder's suspension illustrated the union's "determination to rid South African rugby from the use of prohibited substances".
At the same hearing, Free State forward Jaco Coetzee had a 21-day ban for stamping increased to 51 days because he already had a 30-day suspended sentence for the same offence.
